allowAllGroups.states: Allow every group in your selected data stores to access this application.

dataStores.label: Data Stores
dataStores.description: Select the data stores for this application.  Only users in these data stores can access this application.

groups.label: Groups
groups.description: Only these groups will have access to this application.
groups.validate: allowAllGroups:false and is.required and is.notEmpty or allowAllGroups:true

userIdProfileField.label: User ID Profile Field
userIdProfileField.description: Select the profile field in your data store that contains your users' IDs.

issuer.label: IdP Issuer
issuer.description: Also known as the IdP Entity ID. This is a unique string that identifies the IdP.

assertionConsumerService.label: Assertion Consumer Service URL
assertionConsumerService.description: This URL, provided by Datadog, is used to accept a SAML assertion

relayState.label: Relay State
relayState.description: User will be directed to this URL after authentication

initiationByTooltip.content: The SAML specification allows for Datadog to send their authentication requests (AuthnRequest) to the IdP either by HTTP Post or HTTP Redirect. Your Datadog's configuration or metadata will tell you what is used for the authentication request.

relayStateTooltip.content: Sample provided is the URL format

recipientTooltip.content: This field is typically the same as the consumer URL. It is optional for certain Service Providers.

audienceTooltip.content: Locate this value in the Datadog Admin Console > UserName Profile > Configure SAML.

spLoginUrlTooltip.content: Locate this value in the Datadog Admin Console > UserName Profile > Configure SAML.

acsTooltip.content: Locate this value in the Datadog Admin Console > UserName Profile > Configure SAML.

assertionOffsetMinutesTooltip.content: This is referred to as "SAML Not Before" in the SAML Specification.

assertionValidHoursTooltip.content: This is the time period in which a SAML Assertion is valid. It is referred to as "SAML Not After" in the SAML Specification.

providersCalloutDescription.content: Idp URLs, certificates and metadata files used for integrating with Service Providers.

attributeDeleteTooltipConfirm.message: Are you sure you want to delete this attribute?

noCertificatesAvailable.message: There are no certificates available on the SecureAuth appliance.
noCertificatesAvailable.info: Certificates must be managed and uploaded using the Windows Certificates Console on this appliance.

noSAMLAttributes.message: Add SAML Attributes for your connection
